required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Investigation Using MED3000 Gel or Tadalafil Tablets in the Treatment of Erectile Dysfunction
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-centre, Randomised, Open-label, Home Use, Parallel Group, Clinical Investigation of Topically-applied MED3000 Gel and Oral Tadalafil (5 mg) Tablets for the Treatment of Erectile Dysfunction (ED) Over a 24 Week Period

brief_summary.textblock: An open-label investigation using MED3000 gel or tadalafil (5 mg) tablets in the treatment of erectile dysfunction in patients from 22 to 70 years of age. Each patients will be expected to participate for up to 30 weeks. Eligible patients will be randomised to receive either MED3000 gel or tadalafil (5 mg) tablets in a 1:1 ratio.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients will be randomised to receive either MED3000 gel or tadalafil (5 mg) tablets after a 4 -6 week screening period

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement in EF in patients receiving MED3000 gel
primary_outcome.description: Demonstrate an improvement of erectile function in patients randomised to receive MED3000 using the IIEF-EF patient reported out outcome instrument.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change of EF from baseline score (Rosen et al 2011)
primary_outcome.description: Observe a mean change from baseline (IIEF-EF) is greater or equal to the minimal clinically importance difference as published in Rosen et al 2011

secondary_outcome.measure: Onset of Action speed of MED3000 (onset of erection)
secondary_outcome.description: Demonstrate a speed of onset of action from application of MED3000 gel to the time when patient notices their erection starting.

secondary_outcome.measure: Onset of Action speed of MED3000 (penetrative sex)
secondary_outcome.description: Demonstrate a speed of onset of action from application of MED3000 gel to the time when the patients is able to have penetrative sex.

other_outcome.measure: Difference from baseline scores (MED3000 and tadalafil)
other_outcome.description: Estimate a difference between MED3000 and tadalafil in improvement compared to baseline of IIEF-EF

other_outcome.measure: Mean change in IIEF- EF from baseline scores
other_outcome.description: Evaluate the mean change from baseline (IIEF-EF) at Weeks 4, 8, 12, 16 and 20 post-randomisation

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients reporting improvement in IIEF-EF scores as per Rosen et al 2011
other_outcome.description: Evaluate the proportion of patients reporting a meaningful improvement in IIEF-EF scores according to the criteria published by Rosen et al 2011

other_outcome.measure: Mean score change in questions 3 and 4 in IIEF
other_outcome.description: Evaluate the mean change from baseline scores in questions 3, and 4 of the IIEF assessed at every 4 weeks after randomisation

other_outcome.measure: Mean change in baseline score (other IIEF domains)
other_outcome.description: Evaluate the mean change from baseline of other IIEF domains assessed every 4 weeks after randomisation
Evaluate the sexual intercourse experience using the Self-Esteem And Relationship questionnaire.
Evaluate the safety of MED3000 and tadalafil using the occurence and severity of treatment-emergent adverse events and standard physical and laboratory assessments.

arm_group.description: MED3000 gel formulation topically applied to the glans penis
Tadalafil (5 mg) tablets to be taken orally

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male heterosexual patients aged 22-70 years.
- Confirmed clinical diagnosis of mild, moderate or severe ED for more than 3 months.
- Involved in a continuous heterosexual relationship with their partner for at least 6 months.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any significant cardiovascular, pulmonary, hepatic, renal, gastrointestinal, haematological, endocrinological, metabolic, neurological or psychiatric disease.
- History of unstable medical or psychiatric condition or using any medication that, in the opinion of the Principal Investigator, is likely to affect the patient's ability to complete the investigation or precludes the patient's participation in the investigation.

eligibility.gender_description: Male patients who have had erectile dysfunction for at least 3 months
